Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 186 (Landlord and Te.raw_text: Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 186 (Landlord and Tenant)
Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 186 (Landlord and Te.proposition: Under Massachusetts law, a landlord implicitly covenants that a tenant shall be able to enjoy possession of leased premises without substantial disturbance by the landlord’s acts or omissions and that the premises will be maintained in a condition fit for habitation consistent with applicable statutory and regulatory standards.

105 CMR 410.000 et seq. (sanitary code s.raw_text: 105 CMR 410.000 et seq. (sanitary code standards addressing ventilation, heating and maintenance)
105 CMR 410.000 et seq. (sanitary code s.proposition: The presence of mold in a bathroom, particularly when combined with inadequate ventilation and a landlord’s refusal to remediate or correct ventilation defects, constitutes a substantial interference with the tenant’s use and enjoyment of the premises and may render the premises unfit or unsafe for their ordinary residential use.
